description: Independent research and written report on applying mathematical models to a real-world problem, including draft submission, peer feedback integration, and final submission with mathematical typesetting.
Providing constructive written feedback on peers' Individual Assignment drafts and Group Project presentations, assessed for quality of critique.
2-hour test covering mathematical and conceptual problems from weeks 1-7 content, with a 50% hurdle requirement to pass the course.

Collaborative project involving mathematical analysis of a real-world problem, including background research, model development, coding, group presentation (5%), and written report (25%). Individual contributions may affect final marks.
